alert.note: Alert for Stone; Taney (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 9:45AM CST until December 19 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Christian, Douglas, Ozark, Stone and Taney. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 944 AM CST, The Department of Transportation reported flooding from previous heavy rain in the warned area. Between 1 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Lick Creek at County Road 528, Bull Creek at Center Road, Little North Fork River at County Road 916, Beaver Creek at County Road 524, Pond Fork at County Road 883, Cowskin Creek at Highway Y, Bryant Creek at Highway U, and North Fork River at Highway EE. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Branson, Ava, Kimberling City, Forsyth, Hollister, Silver Dollar City, Merriam Woods and Reeds Spring. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
